org.sd.xml
Class XmlTreeHelper

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.XmlTreeHelper

public class XmlTreeHelper
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for manipulating and interacting with xml trees and data.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Determine whether the tag list has the tag name.

Parameters:
tagList - a list of xml tag instances.
tagName - an already lowercased tag name.
Returns:
true if the tagName appears in the tagList; otherwise, false.

getTextBiteNodes

public static java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> getTextBiteNodes(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Get each text "bite" under the node in document order, where a text "bite" is a node encapsulating contiguous text as determined by the following algorithm:

Any node that has an immediate non-empty text node child is a text bite.

Note that this will typically identify paragraphs, ignoring formatting like bold in html. At times, this may fail to find any smaller bites than the root node.

Clear the attribute on the (tag) node.

Determine whether the node has the property.

getPath

public static final java.lang.String getPath(Tree<XmlLite.Data> shallowNode,
                                             Tree<XmlLite.Data> deepNode,
                                             boolean includeSiblingNumbers,
                                             boolean includeShallowNode)
Build an xpath from the shallow (closer to root) node down to the deep (closer to leaf) node. If include sibling numbers, then create a specific xpath to identify just the given deep node; otherwise, create a general xpath. If include shallow node, add the shallow node's tag to the xpath; otherwise, start from the shallow node's child leading down to deep node.

public static final java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> findTags(Tree<XmlLite.Data> xmlNode,

                                                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> withTag)
Get the deepest nodes in the tree that have one of the tags.

If the tag is not found in a path with a non-empty text node, include the text node.
